Merge pull request #862 from afabre/issue-746

Fixed #746: Registrations added to a nested lifetime scope were not being disposed.

LifetimeScope: Properly dispose of allocated registries.

When a child scope is created, along with its registry, we need to keep track
of what needs to be disposed of later. The registry is part of those things.

The registry passed in the constructor doesn't always fall in that category
(think root scope), and hence the registry is added in the BeginLifetimeScope
methods.

Issue #746

CopyOnWriteRegistry: Pick the correct registry to dispose.

When the registry hasn't been touched, nothing needs to be disposed. Only when
the registry has been modified, and hence a new (write) registry allocated,
should the registry be disposed. This is determined by the _writeRegistry
field being non-null.

Fixes Resharper warnings in that class.

Issue #746

Don't attempt to make contravariant sources for value types.

According to C# spec, contravariance in interfaces doesn't apply to value types.
The ContravariantRegistrationSource was attempting to apply it in such
cases anyway.

the various registrations.

Includes self on GetImplementedInterface calls to interface

For situations where an interface is passed to GetImplementedInterfaces
this adds the actual interface to the list of returned values.

This allows for situations such as registering the return value of a
factory method. Prior to this commit to resolve that type you'd have to
use AsSelf() rather than AsImplementedInterfaces().

Ignore compiler generated classes on assembly scanning / auto-registration.

Ignore compiler generated classes on autoregistration

When dealing with deferred IEnumerables (using yield return/break) the compiler generates a helper class to handle the deferred execution. Autoregistration discovers this class and registers it as a provider for IEnumerable<T> thus preventing the user from being able to resolve all implementations of T.

to EXCLUDE the Autofac packages because we manually specify the required

poked in.

Revert "Switching parallel builds off for MyGet"

This reverts commit 38db46715fc240c8a35039cdb582b9c203a723bb.

Switching parallel builds off for MyGet

MyGet build isn't using app.config files to do assembly binding
redirects during FxCop analysis. StackOverflow
(http://stackoverflow.com/questions/18630002) shows it might be due to
the BuildInParallel flag. Trying out turning it off to see if that fixes
the issue.

Fixed build to work with NuGet dependencies

Updated the build script to copy appropriate files from build locations
in a more targeted fashion so we don't accidentally repackage an old
version of Autofac and publish it as new. Required after the build has
switched to use all NuGet dependencies.
Updated NuGet command line app

Updated MvvmCross to 3.1.0 for dependencies

MvvmCross version changed to 3.1.0 to accommodate for the
back-versioning of the required Autofac dependency. (Used to require
3.3.1 but built against 3.4.0; now will require 3.3.1 and be built
against 3.3.1.)

Dependencies switched to NuGet; minor ver updates

* All project-to-project references switched to NuGet references except
in the case of unit tests referencing exactly the project they test.
This includes the example projects, which ONLY refer to NuGet now. The
examples must refer to NuGet because the versions in the AssemblyInfo.cs
files don't have the published versions from PackageVersions.proj.
* Autofac.Mvc5.Owin nuspec updated to remove dependency on Autofac.Mvc5
(dependency not required).
* Autofac.Extras.Attributed nuspec updated to require a dependency on
Autofac.Integration.Mef (required but previously not specified).
* Autofac.Extras.DomainServices nuspec updated to require a later
version of Autofac (3.4.0) and require Autofac.Web (3.2.0). Autofac.Web
was required before but not specified by the nuspec.
* Autofac.Extras.EnterpriseLibraryConfigurator nuspec updated to remove
dependency on Autofac.Extras.CommonServiceLocator (dependency not
required).
* Autofac.Mvc5.Owin version updated to 3.0.0-alpha4 to reflect removal
of the dependency.
* Autofac.Extras.Attributed version updated to 3.3.0 to reflect the new
dependency requirement.
* Autofac.Extras.DomainServices version updated to 3.1.0 to reflect the
new dependency requirement.
* Autofac.Extras.EnterpriseLibraryConfigurator version updated to 3.0.2
to reflect the removal of the dependency.

Updated Autofac package to 3.4.1 for bug fixes.

This assembly was messing up the build on other platforms due to it not

removed.

some integrations (SignalR, MvvmCross) can't include it.

Enable users to provide ProxyGenerationOptions

Users can now provide their own ProxyGenerationOptions - enabling them to use mixins, IProxyGenerationHook to specify which methods could be intercepted or IInterceptorSelector which enables users to provide valid combination interceptor/methods to intercept

Allow multiple Intercept attributes

Without this, you can use only one InterceptAttribute per class/interface

Merge branch 'master' of https://github.com/autofac/Autofac
Initial commit

Added an Autofac.Integration.Owin package that will be a base package for OWIN integrations for MVC and Web API. It adds DI support for middleware and registers the OWIN context into child lifetime scopes. Also updated some common packages such as NUnit and Moq.
Removed Beta label from FakeItEasy package version.
Commit of updated VersionAssemblyInfo.cs files from last build.
Merge with latest changes.
Made sure correct metadata key is being used for Web API filter overrides.
Added support for MVC filter registrations to be used as filter overrides at the controller and action level.
Merge changes from origin.
Added support for Web API filter registrations to be used as filter overrides at the controller and action level.
Resolved Issue 431: Merged FakeItEasy changes from Adam.
fix for #431
up front tidy up of FakeItEasy extras code
Updated Autofac.Mvc5 package to 3.1.0.
Added fluent API to ContainerBuilder that allows MVC filters (Action, Authentication, Authorization and Exception) to be overriden without the need for applying attributes.
Extracted out a base fixture for theMVC filter unit tests and created separate fixtures for each filter type.
Extracted out a base fixture for the Web API filter unit tests and created separate fixtures for each filter type.
Renamed Web API "filter override" registration methods to avoid conflicts when same methods added to MVC integration.
Resolved issue 465: Added fluent API to ContainerBuilder that allows filters (Action, Authentication, Authorization and Exception) to be overriden without the need for applying attributes.

Clean up in CollectionRegistrationSource and AutowiringPropertyInjector.
Use Moq-4.0.10827.0. Move from obsoleted MockFactory to MockRepository. Add a public static method to create an AutoMock whose behavior is based on the MockRepository parameter.
Add tests for new AutoMock.GetFromRepository behavior.
